instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the expedited myelin detection approach for MS drug discovery?
Output: In the expedited myelin detection approach for MS drug discovery,the researchers used visible spectrum and fluorescence spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the expedited myelin detection approach for MS drug discovery?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used in the expedited myelin detection approach for MS drug discovery included Deep Learning, Discriminant & Regression, k Nearest Neighbors (k-NN), Decision Tree, and Support Vector Machine (SVM).

instruction: What metric was chosen in the expedited myelin detection approach for MS drug discovery?
Output: The metric chosen in the expedited myelin detection approach for MS drug discovery was accuracy.

instruction: What were the results of using the customized convolutional neural network (CNN) compared to the other supervised machine learning techniques in the expedited myelin detection approach for MS drug discovery?
Output:
The results of using the customized convolutional neural network (CNN) in the expedited myelin detection approach for MS drug discovery were as follows:

The customized-CNN achieved a myelin detection performance with an accuracy value of 98.46 +/- 0.11%. This accuracy value was one of the highest among the 23 different supervised machine learning techniques that were assessed.

Therefore, the customized-CNN showed promising results and performed well in detecting myelin in the fluorescence microscopy images. It can be considered as a feasible and robust method for remyelination drug screening in the context of MS drug discovery.

instruction: Can the machine learning-based expedited myelin detection approach using Boosted Trees and the customized CNN be applied to other spectroscopic methods for drug discovery in multiple sclerosis (MS)?
Output: No. Based on the information provided in the related study, it is not explicitly stated whether the machine learning-based expedited myelin detection approach using Boosted Trees and the customized CNN can be applied to other spectroscopic methods for drug discovery in multiple sclerosis (MS). The research only mentions the development of this approach specifically for myelin detection in fluorescence microscopy images. Therefore, it is unclear whether this approach can be directly applied to other spectroscopic methods for drug discovery in MS. Further research and experimentation would be needed to determine the applicability of this approach to other spectroscopic methods.
